message.raw:
Add `_{script_basename}` to default `filename_prefix_format`. It was intended
to be there in the recent sequence index changes, but I mistakenly left it out.
Without it, shots from different scripts aren't so easily identifiable in lyse,
even though the filepath contains the script name in the folder hierarchy

even though the filepath contains the script name in the folder hierarchy

values.message:
Add `_{script_basename}` to default `filename_prefix_format`. It was intended
to be there in the recent sequence index changes, but I mistakenly left it out.
Without it, shots from different scripts aren't so easily identifiable in lyse,
even though the filepath contains the script name in the folder hierarchy

message.raw:
Add pillow as dependency. It is used by labscript to convert marker colour
names to RGB values, and by a (as of yet unmerged) device, the LightCrafter DMD,
to produce BMP images from numpy arrays.

It will already be present on most anaconda installs.

names to RGB values, and by a (as of yet unmerged) device, the LightCrafter DMD,
to produce BMP images from numpy arrays.

It will already be present on most anaconda installs.

names to RGB values, and by a (as of yet unmerged) device, the LightCrafter DMD,
to produce BMP images from numpy arrays.

It will already be present on most anaconda installs.

message.raw:
Remove suggestion to install packages via 'web'. Pip can now handle binary
packages just fine, is the standard method of distribution, and comes with
Python, so there is no need for web installers anymore.

Add configparser dependency - this is the backported 'configparser' module from
Python 3.5 for Python 2. On Python 3 this check succeeds due to the stdlib module,
so no need to make the check version-specific.
Align output of installer when checking depdencies. Makes it easier to read.
message.html:

Python, so there is no need for web installers anymore.

Add configparser dependency - this is the backported 'configparser' module from
Python 3.5 for Python 2. On Python 3 this check succeeds due to the stdlib module,
so no need to make the check version-specific.
Align output of installer when checking depdencies. Makes it easier to read.

Remove suggestion to install packages via 'web'. Pip can now handle binary
packages just fine, is the standard method of distribution, and comes with

values.message:
Remove suggestion to install packages via 'web'. Pip can now handle binary
packages just fine, is the standard method of distribution, and comes with
Python, so there is no need for web installers anymore.

Add configparser dependency - this is the backported 'configparser' module from
Python 3.5 for Python 2. On Python 3 this check succeeds due to the stdlib module,
so no need to make the check version-specific.
Align output of installer when checking depdencies. Makes it easier to read.

message.raw:
In conda 4.6.11, CONDA_PYTHON_EXE does not exist. Modify to use CONDA_EXE instead.

Rejig the version check to call conda and ask for the version rather than
assuming it based on environment variables.

We previously used CONDA_PYTHON_EXE to determine the location of pythonw.exe
and cwp.py. But it was removed in conda 4.6.11. Now we find pythonw.exe and
cwp.py as relative paths to CONDA_EXE, which points to a known path in
the root environment.

Assumptions are made in either case about where things are located within the
anaconda directory, but this cannot be helped since there is no way to know
where these files and executables are in any canonical way at the moment.

values.message:
In conda 4.6.11, CONDA_PYTHON_EXE does not exist. Modify to use CONDA_EXE instead.

Rejig the version check to call conda and ask for the version rather than
assuming it based on environment variables.

We previously used CONDA_PYTHON_EXE to determine the location of pythonw.exe
and cwp.py. But it was removed in conda 4.6.11. Now we find pythonw.exe and
cwp.py as relative paths to CONDA_EXE, which points to a known path in
the root environment.

Assumptions are made in either case about where things are located within the
anaconda directory, but this cannot be helped since there is no way to know
where these files and executables are in any canonical way at the moment.

message.raw:
* Changed shared drive in default config file to ~/labscript_shared on unix
* removed mise port from default config file
* Introduced app_saved_configs path in config file
* change runmanager and lyse autoload_config_file settings to use app_saved_configs
* made installer create default app_saved_configs folder in userlib.
message.html:
• Changed shared drive in default config file to ~/labscript_shared on unix
  • removed mise port from default config file
  • Introduced app_saved_configs path in config file
  • change runmanager and lyse autoload_config_file settings to use app_saved_configs
  • made installer create default app_saved_configs folder in userlib.

summary.raw:
* Changed shared drive in default config file to ~/labscript_shared on unix
* removed mise port from default config file
* Introduced app_saved_configs path in config file
* change runmanager and lyse autoload_config_file settings to use app_saved_configs
* made installer create default app_saved_configs folder in userlib.
summary.html:
• Changed shared drive in default config file to ~/labscript_shared on unix
  • removed mise port from default config file
  • Introduced app_saved_configs path in config file
  • change runmanager and lyse autoload_config_file settings to use app_saved_configs
  • made installer create default app_saved_configs folder in userlib.

values.message:
* Changed shared drive in default config file to ~/labscript_shared on unix
* removed mise port from default config file
* Introduced app_saved_configs path in config file
* change runmanager and lyse autoload_config_file settings to use app_saved_configs
* made installer create default app_saved_configs folder in userlib.

message.raw:
Now installs latest tagged version of lyse from the default branch, which
as of today is the newly released Qt port.

Removes mise, which is still Gtk. In the future optimisation will be done
via a different spec, and any spiritual sucessor to mise will be re-added here.

Stamped as version 2.1.0

message.raw:
Bumped versions to max tagged in default, with exceptions.

Moved the line that needs sudo on linux earlier so it fails sooner and doesn't
leave half an install

Don't check for pywin32 if not windows

Don't print you're making shortcuts if we're on linux and you're not

message.raw:
Now merely checks for dependencies, does not install them.

Also creates a default labconfig file if none is present already.

Also bundles a minimal connection table .py file, to be used by BLACS if
it finds that none exists.

give up and simply provide users with the list, possibly in the right format
to be passed to pip or conda.

message.raw:
Nope, there doesn't seem to be a way to get bitbucket to display the markdown
*and* have it be a plain .txt file so that it has a file association on Windows

Thus, have reverted it to a plain text file.
